intro: Phlomidopsis maximowiczii, commonly known as the Korean phlomidopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Phlomidopsis maximowiczii is native to East Asia, including regions of Korea, Japan, and China.
